webflow.title: Product Bundler
webflow.description: Create custom product bundles from your existing inventory. This app allows you to group multiple product variants together and sell them as a single unit, automatically creating a new product in Shopify to represent the bundle.

bundle.description: The core model for storing bundle information, including its title, description, and price. It is connected to a shop and holds the components that make up the bundle.

bundleComponent.description: A join model that links a `bundle` to a `shopifyProductVariant`, specifying the quantity of each component within the bundle.

shopifyProductVariant.description: Represents a Shopify product variant. Extended with metafields (`isBundle`, `componentReference`) to identify which variants are bundles and what they contain.

create.description: Creates a new bundle record in the Gadget database. This is the first step before the bundle is created in Shopify.

update.description: Updates an existing bundle record in the Gadget database.

createBundleInShopify.description: A global action that takes a bundle ID, creates a corresponding product and variant in Shopify, and sets the necessary metafields to link them.

api/actions/createBundleInShopify.ts.description: Handles the logic for creating a new product in Shopify that represents a bundle. It sets the price, SKU, and metafields required for the bundling functionality to work.

bundle.description: Allows authenticated Shopify merchants to create, read, update, and delete their own bundles through the app's admin UI.

web/routes/_app._index.tsx.description: The main dashboard for the app, displaying a list of all created bundles for the merchant's shop.

web/routes/_app.bundle.($id).tsx.description: The page for creating a new bundle or editing an existing one. It includes a form to set the bundle's details and a component to select the product variants to include.
